snippet: Critics said the administration was understating emergency response times to justify closing firehouses, but Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg said the report was not ready.
abstract: New York City Mayor Michael R Bloomberg is criticized for keeping secret what is said to be a sharply critical report of city's much-delayed and over-budget 911 emergency dispatch system; Bloomberg insists that report will be released when it is complete; 911 system has become an issue in a dispute between the Bloomberg administration and firefighters, who claim that the city has understated 911 response times to justify cutbacks.

byline.original: By DAVID M. HALBFINGER and KATE TAYLOR

lead_paragraph: Critics said the administration was understating emergency response times to justify closing firehouses, but Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg said the report was not ready.

headline.seo: Bloomberg Defends Withholding Report on 911 System
headline.main: Mayor Defends Withholding Report on 911 System
headline.print_headline: Bloomberg Critics Push To Get 911 System Report
